docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Backup/restore mysql databases
docs.text: How to back up and restore mysql databases in School server?

docs.title: mysqldump to backup database to a file
docs.text:
Command (from Gripen Kwok; added --no-tablespaces option; replace <USERNAME>, <PASSWORD>, <DATABASE> with real username, password and database name) 

mysqldump -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD> --lock-tables=false -q --single-transaction  --extended-insert --disable-keys --flush-privileges --quick --routines --triggers --no-tablespaces --databases <DATABASE> | gzip > DB.sql.gz

  1. backup database sbms (timetable etc) into sbms-DB.sql.gz 

    mysqldump -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD> --lock-tables=false -q --single-transaction  --extended-insert --disable-keys --flush-privileges --quick --routines --triggers --no-tablespaces --databases sbms | gzip > sbms-DB.sql.gz

  2. backup database sbmsnew (school web site) into sbmsnew-DB.sql.gz 

    mysqldump -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD> --lock-tables=false -q --single-transaction  --extended-insert --disable-keys --flush-privileges --quick --routines --triggers --no-tablespaces --databases sbmsnew | gzip > sbmsnew-DB.sql.gz

  3. backup database biochem (equipment list) into biochem-DB.sql.gz 

    mysqldump -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD> --lock-tables=false -q --single-transaction  --extended-insert --disable-keys --flush-privileges --quick --routines --triggers --no-tablespaces --databases biochem | gzip > biochem-DB.sql.gz

docs.title: Restore databases
docs.text:
gunip mysqldump files: 

gunzip sbms-DB.sql.gz
gunzip sbmsnew-DB.sql.gz
gunzip biochem-DB.sql.gz

Log in mysql: 

mysql -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD>
Restore database: 
mysql> use <DATABASE>
mysql> \W
mysql> source <mysqldump_file>
mysql> exit

  1. Restore database sbms (for timetable etc) 

    mysql -u <USERNAME> -p<password>

    mysql> use sbms
mysql> \W
mysql> source sbms-DB.sql
mysql> exit

  2. Restore database sbmsnew: (for school website etc) 

    mysql -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD>

    mysql> use sbmsnew
mysql> \W
mysql> source sbmsnew-DB.sql
mysql> exit

  3. Restore database biochem (for equipment list): 

    mysql -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD>

    mysql> use biochem
mysql> \W
mysql> source biochem-DB.sql
mysql> exit
